metadata.title: CVE-2023-6535 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NVMe driver. This issue may allow anunauthenticated malicious actor to send a set of crafted TCP packages whenusing NVMe over TCP, leading the NVMe driver to a NULL pointer dereferencein the NVMe driver, causing kernel panic and a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6535` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
